definition: to reduce fever
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
antipyretic (drug to reduce fever, such as sulfanilamide)

sentences.english: The strange, new style of dancing is slowly dying out.
sentences.chinese: 那种奇怪的新舞步正在慢慢地退烧当中。

sentences.english: Non-aspirin fever reducers can be used to reduce a fever.
sentences.chinese: 不含阿斯匹林的解热药可以用来退烧。

sentences.english: You need to take some medicine.
Let the air reach his body. This will help the fever go down.
sentences.chinese: 让气流触摸你的身体，以助于退烧。

sentences.english: When chicken pox fever, antipyretics can eat it?
sentences.chinese: 出水痘时发高烧，可以吃退烧药吗？

sentences.english: Changes in the office property market is facing anti-fever favor with the market?
sentences.chinese: 楼市退烧市场面临盘整房价变动是众望所归？

sentences.english: Pain and fever can be treated with over-the-counter medications (caution: aspirin should not be given to children).
sentences.chinese: 可以用一些止疼药，用于口腔的疼痛，或退烧药。

sentences.english: I took some medicine last night,but fever doesn't seem to go away.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚我吃了些药，但仍没退烧。

sentences.english: The stems are used as febrifuge and are one of the ingredients to cure malaria.
sentences.chinese: 东革阿里的树干是退烧和治愈疟疾的良药。
把这些综合维他命和退烧药吃下去。

sentences.english: He cannot come to school because he still had faver.
sentences.chinese: 他今天不能来上课，他还没有退烧。

sentences.english: Is this the end of gold fever for now?
sentences.chinese: 已经到了黄金热退烧的时候了吗？

sentences.english: I'll give the baby analgin nose drops to bring down the temperature first.
sentences.chinese: 我给这孩手打安乃近鼻部点滴来退烧。

sentences.english: She dosed him with non-aspirin tablets to reduce the fever.
sentences.chinese: 她让他服用非阿司匹林药片降温退烧。

sentences.english: You can take oral anti-fever medicine.
sentences.chinese: 您可以服用口服退烧药。

definition: to reduce fever
antipyretic (drug to reduce fever, such as sulfanilamide)
to have a high temperature (from illness)/to have a fever
a low fever (up to 38°C)
to catch cold/(common) cold/CL:場|场[chang2],次[ci4]/(coll.) to be interested in (often used in the negative)/(Tw) to detest/can't stand
Ibuprofen or Nurofen/also called 異丁苯丙酸|异丁苯丙酸
fever/high temperature
intravenous infusion/to get put on an IV
anti-inflammatory medicine
to take medicine
analgin (loanword)
to put sb on an intravenous drip
(dialect) to put sb on an intravenous drip
antivirals
to apply a cold compress
to take sb's temperature
